Recipe.title: Pie Crust Pastry
Recipe.Description: The first step to making a pie is to make its crust. This recipe is good for an 8&inch; pie with a top crust, or two 8&inch; pies without a top crust.

section.instruction: If the pie crust is to be baked before filling, preheat the oven to 425°.
In a mixing bowl, combine dry ingredients, and mix well.
Add Cold Butter and Shortening, and cut in with a pastry blender.
Add Cold Water and stir until dough is consistent.
Take half of the dough and make a round ball.
Place between two sheets of wax paper and use a rolling pin to roll into a 12&inch; diameter circle.
Gently, remove top sheet of wax paper.
Carefully place, centered, on top of pie pan, with wax paper up.
Gently remove other sheet of wax paper.
Adjust so that dough evenly covers all of pie pan, and has extra dough hanging over outside edges.
On the outside of the pan, cut dough off about ½&inch; from top of the pan.
Go around the pan, rolling the dough up to the top of the pan, then gently pinch, side-by-side, so that it stays in place.

Baking Instructions:
For pies that are baked in the crust, follow baking instruction for that pie.
For other pies bake at 425° for 15 minutes.

Notes.note: A Pastry Blender is not an electrical appliance! It is a hand-held tool with a bunch of blades used to gently mix doughs of this sort. If you cannot find a pastry blender, use a fork.
